meanings.definition: One of two or more compounds with the same molecular formula but different structural arrangements.
meanings.sent1: An isomer can have the same atoms but arranged differently in a molecule.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study isomers to understand how molecules can vary in structure.
meanings.sent3: The isomer decided to switch places with its twin just to confuse the chemists.
meanings.sent4: The concept of isomers is like having identical twins with different personalities.
meanings.sent5: Imagine isomers as puzzle pieces that fit together in unique ways.

meanings.sent1: Identifying an isomer requires analyzing its structural differences.
meanings.sent2: Chemists use advanced techniques to distinguish between different isomers.
meanings.sent3: The isomer at the party kept changing its outfit to confuse everyone.
meanings.sent4: In the world of chemistry, isomers are like shape-shifters with identical compositions.
meanings.sent5: Visualizing isomers is like seeing reflections that look similar but have distinct features.
